component.title: Ignite Cache
component.description: The Ignite Cache endpoint is one of camel-ignite endpoints which allows you to interact with an Ignite Cache.
component.label: nosql,cache,compute

configurationResource.description: Sets the resource from where to load the configuration. It can be a: URI, String (URI) or an InputStream.

igniteConfiguration.description: Allows the user to set a programmatic IgniteConfiguration.

basicPropertyBinding.label: advanced
basicPropertyBinding.description: Whether the component should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

lazyStartProducer.label: producer
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

bridgeErrorHandler.label: consumer
bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

propagateIncomingBodyIfNoReturnValue.displayName: Propagate Incoming Body If No Return Value
propagateIncomingBodyIfNoReturnValue.description: Sets whether to propagate the incoming body if the return type of the underlying Ignite operation is void.

treatCollectionsAsCacheObjects.description: Sets whether to treat Collections as cache objects or as Collections of items to insert/update/compute, etc.

autoUnsubscribe.label: consumer
autoUnsubscribe.description: Whether auto unsubscribe is enabled in the Continuous Query Consumer.

bridgeErrorHandler.label: consumer
bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

fireExistingQueryResults.label: consumer
fireExistingQueryResults.description: Whether to process existing results that match the query. Used on initialization of the Continuous Query Consumer.

oneExchangePerUpdate.label: consumer
oneExchangePerUpdate.description: Whether to pack each update in an individual Exchange, even if multiple updates are received in one batch. Only used by the Continuous Query Consumer.

pageSize.label: consumer
pageSize.description: The page size. Only used by the Continuous Query Consumer.

query.label: producer,consumer
query.description: The Query to execute, only needed for operations that require it, and for the Continuous Query Consumer.

remoteFilter.label: consumer
remoteFilter.description: The remote filter, only used by the Continuous Query Consumer.

timeInterval.label: consumer
timeInterval.description: The time interval for the Continuous Query Consumer.

exceptionHandler.label: consumer,advanced
exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

exchangePattern.label: consumer,advanced
exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.

cachePeekMode.label: producer
cachePeekMode.description: The CachePeekMode, only needed for operations that require it (IgniteCacheOperation#SIZE).

failIfInexistentCache.label: producer
failIfInexistentCache.description: Whether to fail the initialization if the cache doesn't exist.

lazyStartProducer.label: producer
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

operation.label: producer
operation.description: The cache operation to invoke. Possible values: GET, PUT, REMOVE, SIZE, REBALANCE, QUERY, CLEAR.

basicPropertyBinding.label: advanced
basicPropertyBinding.description: Whether the endpoint should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

synchronous.label: advanced
synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).
